Crimes.Crime_Name: Potential breach of Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations s.117(9)(d)
Crimes.Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Involved: s.117(9)(d) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
Crimes.Outcome: Federal Court dismissed the application; no reviewable error found
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Whether IAD erred in law or fact by not determining s.117(9)(d) applicability
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act and Regulations
Crimes.Evidence_Requirement: Proof of relationship status and timing relative to sponsor’s permanent residence
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: IAD decision upheld, case remitted to visa officer
Crimes.Institutional_Action: IAD remitted case to visa officer for assessment under s.117(9)(d)
Crimes.Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds potentially applicable
Crimes.Individual_Status_or_Claim: Sponsor (Kimbatsa) is permanent resident; Bayonne claimed common-law partner status
Crimes.Legal_Statute: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations s.117(9)(d)
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether foreign national was examined during sponsor’s application process
Crimes.Complaint_Issues: Failure to assess s.117(9)(d) at initial stage
Crimes.Credibility: Not central; factual findings on cohabitation accepted
Crimes.Legal_Basis: Regulatory bar to sponsorship for unexamined family members

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to disclose common law partner in permanent residence application
Crimes.Dispute_Type: Omission in immigration application affecting sponsorship eligibility
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Effect of non-disclosure of common-law partner on subsequent sponsorship
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations s.117(9)(d)
Crimes.Outcome: IAD allowed appeal; remitted to visa officer; judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Appeal from refusal of family class sponsorship
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Omission attributed to refugee circumstances, not bad faith
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate considerations for late disclosure
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Reasonableness of IAD’s factual findings and legal interpretation
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Timing of relationship vs. sponsor’s application; reason for omission
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to declare Bayonne as common-law partner in 2004 application
Crimes.Review_Outcome: Judicial review dismissed; IAD decision upheld
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Was omission intentional or excusable under context?
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Materiality of omission and intent behind non-disclosure
Crimes.Application_Factor: Refugee status constraints affecting disclosure ability
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Case remitted for further assessment under s.117(9)(d)
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether IAD erred in finding cohabitation and remitting case
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Non-disclosure of common-law partner during initial application
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Proof of prior cohabitation despite late declaration
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Right to appeal preserved; procedural fairness upheld
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Remittal for proper consideration of legal provision
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Potential ineligibility under family class due to non-examination
